name: GetDebitReversalsList
description:
Retrieves a list of debit reversals from Stripe.

Use this tool to obtain a list of debit reversals from the Stripe Treasury API, which provides details on reversed debit transactions.

parameters.name: financial_account_id
parameters.description: The ID of the FinancialAccount to retrieve associated debit reversals.

value_schema.description: Returns objects associated with this FinancialAccount.

parameters.name: pagination_ending_before_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor object ID for pagination. Use this to fetch the previous page of the list.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `ending_before` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with `obj_bar`, your subsequent call can include `ending_before=obj_bar` in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

parameters.name: fields_to_expand
parameters.description: A list of fields in the response to expand for obtaining additional nested information.

value_schema.description: Specifies which fields in the response should be expanded.

parameters.name: max_number_of_debit_reversals
parameters.description: The maximum number of debit reversals to return. Must be between 1 and 100. Defaults to 10 if not specified.

value_schema.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 10.

parameters.name: filter_by_received_debit_id
parameters.description: The ID of the ReceivedDebit to filter debit reversals by. Only returns reversals for this specific ID.

value_schema.description: Only return DebitReversals for the ReceivedDebit ID.

parameters.name: resolution_status
parameters.description: Filter DebitReversals based on the resolution ('lost' or 'won').

value_schema.description: Only return DebitReversals for a given resolution.

parameters.name: pagination_starting_after_cursor
parameters.description: An object ID that serves as a pagination cursor for fetching the next page of results.

value_schema.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `starting_after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with `obj_foo`, your subsequent call can include `starting_after=obj_foo` in order to fetch the next page of the list.

parameters.name: filter_by_status
parameters.description: Specify the status of DebitReversals to return. Options are: 'canceled', 'completed', or 'processing'.

value_schema.description: Only return DebitReversals for a given status.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Stripe API.
